page.title: 09HARVARD COMMON COLD UNIT
page.content: The Harvard Cold unit is on the South boundary of Salisbury. It was established in 1946 by Sir Christopher Andrews. It has 30 employees,cosisting of 3 Virologists,Administrative staff,Porters & Cleaning /Catering staff. The units budget is Â£300,000 a year,paid by the Tax payers,& Â£1000 is provided for each volunteer by drug firms. The Unit can have 30 volunteers at any one time,& the volunteers are paid Â£1.75 a day. They have a nine day test period which includes blood & drug tests. They have indoor sports facilities, & may take walks if they stay away from others.The results, studied under an ordinary microscope, are then sent off for analysis under an electron microscope. So far they have discovered the Rhino virus which causes 2/3rds of common colds.
